alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Red Lodge Foothills; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:41PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm produced wind gusts will impact portions of east central Stillwater, north central Carbon and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 335 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms producing locally strong wind gusts from near Columbus to near Billings, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. The strong winds may move out well away from any precipitation areas. Locations impacted include... Billings, Columbus, Laurel, Joliet, Lockwood, Huntley, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Worden, Billings West End, Ballantine, Boyd, Silesia, Cooney Reservoir State Park, Park City and Rockvale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Those on Cooney Reservoir should move off the lake until thunderstorms and strong winds move out of the area.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Red Lodge Foothills; Southwestern Yellowstone
